thread.title: Kern gets 1st catch but not many more
thread.title_full: Kern gets 1st catch but not many more

author: David Kelly
title: Kern gets 1st catch but not many more
text:
Kern gets 1st catch but not many more Posted: TUCSON, AZ (Tucson News Now) - 
The tight end is not back at Arizona after all. 
At least not yet in the passing game. 
Wildcats starting tight end Josh Kern has four catches for 20 yards in the team’s first four games. He’s the only tight end who has seen significant playinig time or targets in the early part of the season. 
Kern caught his first career pass for UA, an 11-yarder, in the second quarter of the season-opening win over UTSA. 
There was a belief that the Cats might start to utilize the position in the pass game more after the tight ends saw frequent action in the spring including ten receptions between the group in the annual Spring Game. 
But UA lost a big target to injury during Fall Camp when sophomore Trevor Wood was shut down for the season with a shoulder injury. 
The primary offensive role for Kern and backups Matt Morin and Darrell Cloy has been blocking. 
Our David Kelly asked head coach Rich Rodriguez about the status of the tight end in the passing game plus got reaction from Kern on his first collegiate catch.
